title: Seen as nostalgia goes in 20 year cycles (e.g. 70s in 90s, 80s in 2000s and 90s in 2010s), will 2000s nostalgia be a thing in the 2020s? - Quora

response.answer_text: Absolutely the 00s will be nostalgic in the 2020s, it’s already started, weirdly 90s nostalgia didn’t get much of a focus because of a continued obsession with the 80s, but the 00s looks set to bump both decades out of the spotlight: How "Thank U, Next" & More ‘90s & ‘00s-Inspired Music Videos Help Ease Millennial Anxiety Fetch Is Actually Happening: How We Traded the '90s For 2000s Nostalgia Much like how the boomers started the 60s wave of nostalgia in the 80s, millennials are starting a 00s wave ahead of the 2020s. The 00s will be nostalgic because many thirty somethings will be looking back to a simpler, less toxic time, a time when Donald Trump was just a TV star, when Brexit wasn’t even a word.

Seeing as we tend to feel nostalgic for things we experienced as a teen-ager / during our formative years, I'd say yes - it would be perfectly normal for people who lived through the early 2000s to feel nostalgic about it (heck, I already feel nostalgic about that era when I hear some of the electronic music from it and I was in my 20s during that decade).
